intro: Achoriphragma beketovii, commonly known as the Khabarovsk bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
